001package org.consensusj.bitcoinj.signing;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.base.Address;
004import org.bitcoinj.base.Coin;
005import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
006import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
007import java.util.List;
008import java.util.Map;
009import java.util.stream.Collectors;
010
011// A SigningRequest should be immutable *and* complete/ready-to-sign. There should be some kind of SigningRequestBuilder
012// to build a SigningRequest.
013/**
014 * A transaction signing request with immutable data specifying the transaction.
015 * <p>
016 * This is an experiment as to what immutable transactions might look like in <b>bitcoinj</b>.
017 * At some point in the future I would like to propose some refactoring in bitcoinj to implement
018 * immutable transactions in a mostly-compatible way with the existing transaction classes.
019 */
020public interface SigningRequest {
021    /**
022     * This property is only here because bitcoinj {@link org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction} currently requires
023     * this information for construction. This will be removed in the future when bitcoinj is updated.
024     * @return the id string for the network
025     */
026    @Deprecated
027    String networkId();
028    Network network();
029    List<TransactionInputData> inputs();
030    List<TransactionOutputData> outputs();
031
032    static SigningRequest of(Network network, List<TransactionInputData> inputs, List<TransactionOutputData> outputs) {
033        return new DefaultSigningRequest(network, inputs, outputs);
034    }
035
036    static SigningRequest of(Network network, List<TransactionInputData> inputs, Map<Address, Coin> outputMap) {
037        List<TransactionOutputData> outs = outputMap.entrySet().stream()
038                .map(e -> new TransactionOutputAddress(e.getValue(), e.getKey()))
039                .collect(Collectors.toList());
040        return SigningRequest.of(network, inputs, outs);
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * bitcoinj signing (currently) uses mutable {@link Transaction} objects, this convenience method will create
045     * a completed, unsigned bitcoinj {@code Transaction} if you want to use bitcoinj to sign this request.
046     * @return an unsigned bitcoinj transaction
047     */
048    Transaction toUnsignedTransaction();
049}
